description: "Honestly, I can't wait to have grandkids and spoil them—but I don't want to be called "Granny.'" (overheard on the No. 96 tram in Melbourne)
title: From cauldrons to cardigans—the lurking prejudices behind the name 'Granny'

description: In the build-up to his government's first budget, Prime Minister Keir Starmer has been setting expectations low. It will be "painful," he has warned, and a "difficult trade-off" will have to be made because of the economic inheritance left by the last government.
title: Evidence tells us voters might be convinced to accept short-term pain for long-term gain—but it will be a hard sell

description: When tickets for Green Day's 2025 Australian tour went on sale, fans joined a queue—a ritual that has been practiced for decades on footpaths, on phones, and now online.
title: What is 'dynamic pricing' for concert tickets? It can cost you hundreds of dollars while you queue

description: Researchers have reconstructed the oldest human genomes ever found in South Africa from two people who lived around 10,000 years ago, allowing a better understanding of how the region was populated, an author of the study said Sunday.
title: Researchers decode oldest human DNA from South Africa to date

description: After an unexpected measurement by the Collider Detector at Fermilab (CDF) experiment in 2022, physicists on the Compact Muon Solenoid experiment (CMS) at the Large Hadron Collider (LHC) announced today a new mass measurement of the W boson, one of nature's force-carrying particles.
title: New results from the CMS experiment put W boson mass mystery to rest

description: Antiferromagnets are materials in which the magnetic moments of neighboring atoms are aligned in an alternating pattern, resulting in no net macroscopic magnetism. These materials have interesting properties that could be favorable for the development of spintronic and electronic devices.
title: Researchers observe an antiferromagnetic diode effect in even-layered MnBi₂Te₄

description: The rhino population across the world has increased slightly but so have the killings, mostly in South Africa, as poaching fed by huge demand for rhino horns remains a top threat, conservationists said in a new report.
title: The number of rhinos is slightly up but poaching has increased too

description: A new statistical technique developed by a researcher at the Texas A&M University School of Public Health and colleagues elsewhere offers fresh insights into how diseases affect individual cells. This innovative method, known as hybrid Bayesian inference, blends different statistical approaches to better understand complex diseases like idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, which has long puzzled scientists due to its elusive nature.
title: Innovative statistical method reveals new insights into single-cell RNA sequencing

description: As anyone who's spent time in the saddle knows, riding a horse can be hard on your body. But can it change the way your skeleton looks?
title: Scientists explore origins of horseback riding through human skeletons
